title: Load valid JSON reports successfully
description: Verify that the application automatically loads all valid JSON reconnaissance reports from the /reports/ directory without errors and validates them against the schema.

steps.description: Place multiple valid JSON reconnaissance reports into the /reports/ directory
Start the dashboard application
Check that all valid reports are loaded, parsed, and displayed in the detailed reports table
Verify no critical errors or notifications about invalid schema appear

title: Handle malformed JSON reports gracefully
description: Verify the application detects malformed or corrupted JSON files in /reports/, does not crash, and displays user-friendly error notifications.

steps.description: Place one or more malformed JSON files in the /reports/ directory
Start the dashboard application
Check that the malformed files are not loaded into the reports table
Verify user-friendly error messages or alerts indicating which files failed validation
Ensure the application continues to operate normally with valid reports loaded

title: KPI summary cards display correct aggregated data
description: Verify the KPI cards accurately reflect total number of loaded reports, subdomains, open ports, and vulnerabilities based on loaded data.

steps.description: Load a predefined set of reconnaissance reports with known metrics
Confirm that the Total Reports KPI card shows the expected number of reports
Verify the Subdomains KPI card matches the total unique subdomains across all reports
Check the Open Ports KPI card value corresponds to average or sum as defined
Ensure the Vulnerabilities KPI card reflects the correct count or statistics

title: Filtering controls correctly filter report data
description: Verify filtering by target, date range, and keyword search updates the displayed reports and all visualizations accordingly.

steps.description: Load multiple reports covering various targets, dates, and keywords
Apply target filter in the sidebar selecting a specific target(s)
Verify only reports matching target filter are shown in the reports table
Confirm all charts and KPI cards update to reflect filtered dataset
Apply a date range filter using the sidebar controls
Verify displayed reports fall within selected date range and other views update accordingly
Enter a keyword into the search field filtering reports, subdomains, or vulnerabilities
Ensure reported data, summaries, and visualizations respect the keyword filter

title: Interactive charts render correctly and handle large datasets
description: Verify that the subdomain distribution bar chart, open ports pie chart, and timeline activity line chart render properly including handling large datasets via truncation, grouping, or pagination.

steps.description: Load a large volume of reports with many subdomains, ports, and activity dates
Verify the subdomain distribution bar chart renders with a manageable number of bars (truncated or sorted)
Confirm the open ports pie chart groups less common ports into the 'Other' category
Check timeline activity line chart shows aggregated data trends and handles date parsing correctly
Interact with chart elements (hover, click) to verify interactivity
Ensure charts respond to filtering and update accordingly without errors

title: Detailed reports table supports sorting, pagination, and expandable views
description: Verify the table presenting report summaries allows sorting by columns, supports pagination controls, and expandable rows to show detailed information including subdomains, open ports, vulnerabilities, and AI summaries.

steps.description: Load multiple reports sufficient to require multiple pagination pages
Sort the table by different columns such as date, target, and vulnerability count
Verify the table rows reorder correctly based on selected column and sort direction
Navigate between pagination pages
Confirm table data updates correctly when changing pages without errors
Click to expand a report row to view detailed report information
Verify expandable view shows subdomains, open ports, vulnerabilities, and any cached AI summaries properly

title: AI threat summaries generate properly with valid API key
description: Verify AI threat summary generation functions work when a valid OpenRouter API key is configured, including batch processing, caching of results, progress display, and error handling.

steps.description: Configure a valid OpenRouter API key via environment variable or dashboard input
Select one or multiple reports to generate AI threat summaries
Trigger AI summary generation (single and batch mode)
Observe progress indicators showing summary generation status
Verify AI summaries display correctly in the expandable report details
Initiate AI summary generation for previously summarized reports
Ensure cached summaries are retrieved from cache instead of triggering new API calls

title: AI summary generation handles missing or invalid API key
description: Verify the application shows appropriate error messages and prevents AI summary generation when API key is missing, invalid, or expired.

steps.description: Ensure no API key is configured or configure an invalid API key
Attempt to generate AI threat summaries
Verify clear error message indicates API key issues
Confirm that AI summary generation does not proceed

title: Session state persists user selections and loaded data across refreshes
description: Verify that user selections such as filters, sorting, expanded rows, and loaded data persist after browser refresh or navigation within the app.

steps.description: Apply multiple filters including target and date range
Sort the reports table and expand one or more report rows
Refresh the browser or navigate away and back to the dashboard
Verify the filters, sorting, expanded rows, and loaded data remain as previously configured

title: Comprehensive error handling with user friendly messages
description: Verify all components including data loading, AI analysis, filtering, and visualization handle unexpected errors gracefully, providing clear user feedback and recovery options.

steps.description: Simulate errors such as corrupt file read failure, API call failure, and visualization rendering issues
Verify user-friendly error messages are shown describing error cause
Check recovery options are available (e.g. retry button, manual refresh)
Ensure application remains responsive and other features continue to function

title: API key configuration with environment variable support and validation
description: Verify the secure input and validation of the OpenRouter API key in the UI and confirm environment variable overrides take effect correctly with status indicators shown.

steps.description: Set a valid API key as an environment variable before starting the application
Verify the dashboard reflects the key as configured and displays status indicator confirming validity
Input or update the API key in the dashboard UI
Verify the entered key is validated and status updates accordingly
Input an invalid or malformed key
Check that validation errors are shown and key is not accepted

title: Manual data refresh and force reload functionality
description: Verify manual refresh and force reload operations reload data from /reports/ directory correctly and refresh all views, handling any data loading issues.

steps.description: Modify or add new JSON report files in the /reports/ directory after initial load
Use manual refresh button in the UI
Verify new or updated reports appear in the reports table and visualizations update accordingly
Use force reload option to clear caches and reload all data
Confirm all caches are cleared and data refreshes completely from source files
Check that no stale data remains in KPI cards, tables, or AI caches

title: AI summary caching reduces redundant API calls and persists across sessions
description: Verify the caching system stores AI threat summaries, prevents repeated API calls for same report data, and persists cached results after app restart.

steps.description: Generate AI summary for one or more reports with valid API key
Verify API calls are made and summaries are displayed
Trigger AI summary generation again for the same reports
Verify summaries are fetched from cache with no new API calls
Restart the application
Verify cached AI summaries persist and can be accessed without new API calls

title: Report validation against schema with detailed error reporting
description: Verify that all loaded reconnaissance JSON reports are validated against the defined schema and that violations generate clear error reports and data quality indicators in the UI.

steps.description: Include JSON reports with schema errors such as missing fields or incorrect data types
Start or refresh the dashboard
Check error messages identify schema violations per file clearly
Verify that data quality indicators reflect the validity status of each report
Ensure partially valid reports are loaded with warnings where applicable

title: Help system and sample data displayed correctly to users
description: Verify that the sample report format and help documentation are accessible, accurate, and assist new users in understanding the expected input data and usage.

steps.description: Navigate to the help or sample data section of the dashboard
Confirm sample JSON report format is displayed clearly
Verify help guidance covers loading, filtering, AI summary generation, and troubleshooting

title: Debug panel and system status monitoring works correctly
description: Verify that debug information and system status can be accessed, display relevant logs and system health, and assist in troubleshooting the applicationâ€™s operation.

steps.description: Open the debug panel or status monitoring interface in the dashboard
Verify system logs, error history, and status indicators are shown
Trigger common errors (e.g., bad file load, API failure) to generate logs
Confirm corresponding log entries and status updates appear in debug panel
